https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/decal

We're aware the DeCal proposal procedures will need to shift a bit given we're all off-campus. This post (or e-mail) is to give you the information you need to be ready to be successful at proposing a fall 2020 decal given what we know so far. If you know other students who may not be on this list who you think might be interested in teaching a DeCal, please share this information with them.

As the COVID-19 shelter-in-place orders continue, the Academic Senate will begin accepting student-facilitated course proposals (including DeCals) for Fall 2020 via online submission of a Google Form. Please review the submission instructions below and share it with your student facilitators as appropriate:

1) Student-facilitated course proposals (including DeCals) for Fall 2020 may be submitted via this link (the form is also available at tinyurl.com/SFCFall2020).

2) The student facilitator will need to upload three separate documents to the form:

  1. The completed course proposal form (including the unit value worksheet). This will need to include signatures from the instructor of record and department chair. DocuSign and similar electronic signatures are acceptable.

  2. A fully developed syllabus.

  3. The faculty letter of support.

3) Upon submitting the proposal, the student will receive a copy of their responses via email, which will also allow them to sign back in and edit their responses if needed (be sure to keep a copy of that email).

4) Once the Academic Senate receives the proposal, it will be reviewed for compliance with Senate policies and guidelines. Any feedback or request for corrections will be sent to the student facilitator, with a copy to the department contact. The student facilitator will be able to sign back into the Google Form and edit their previous submission by replacing the original file with a new file.

The campus deadline for submission of proposals to be offered in Fall 2020 is Monday, July 13, 2020. EECS deadline to have completed proposals submitted to the EE or CS chair is Monday. July 6, 2020.  Once the Academic Senate offices reopen, after the shelter-in-place orders are lifted, the Senate will accept submission either via this Google Form or via paper submission.

Any questions about this temporary submission process (that department staff can't answer) should be directed to: sumali@berkeley.edu.

All requirements for student-facilitated courses and proposals remain the same as from previous semesters. This includes requirements for training, securing departmental approval, sending a copy of course proposals to the Senate, and so forth. Further information may be found on the Student-Facilitated Course Information section of the Academic Senate’s website. 

UCFTR's training workshops (that all DeCal facilitators need to take before they submit their proposals) are going virtual for the rest of the semester! This means that if student facilitators have access to a computer and a strong WiFi connection, they may be able to join in the virtual training workshops hosted via Zoom. The next set of dates are available on the SLC-UCFTR website and will continue to be updated to add additional sessions each week, so we encourage students to check back in the future if the currently listed dates will not work for your schedules.  
Any questions about these trainings can be sent to the UCFTR Program <slc-ucftr@berkeley.edu> .

Until soon, stay healthy and kind.

Hello Good People,
A quick note to share that we're aware the DeCal proposal procedures will need to shift a bit given we're all off-campus. This post (or e-mail) is to give you the information you need to be ready to be successful at proposing a fall 2020 decal given what we know so far. If you know other students who may not be on this list who you think might be interested in teaching a DeCal, please share this information with them.
The first thing is that UCFTR's training workshops (that all DeCal facilitators need to take before they submit their proposals) are going virtual for the rest of the semester! This means that if student facilitators have access to a computer and a strong WiFi connection, they may be able to join in the virtual training workshops hosted via Zoom. The next set of dates are available on the SLC-UCFTR website and will continue to be updated to add additional sessions each week, so we encourage students to check back in the future if the currently listed dates will not work for your schedules.  
Currently, the scheduled workshops are as follows:

 4/9 (Thursday), 4-5pm | Click here to register for our virtual session

(link is external)

4/8 (Wednesday), 3-4pm | Click here to register for our virtual session

Any questions about these trainings can be sent to the UCFTR Program <slc-ucftr@berkeley.edu> .
We are asking campus what changes may be made in terms of signatures and deadlines, etc. so the link I share below isn't completely set in stone for F20 DeCals but it will give you an idea and links to useful information that DOESN'T take the pandemic into account (yet).

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/decal

Until soon, stay healthy and kind.
